snippet: Strong voices lift “My Fair Lady,” a Lerner and Loewe masterpiece, above some awkward scenery and acting at the Gateway Playhouse in Bellport.
abstract: Aileen Jacobson reviews musical My Fair Lady, with book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner and music by Frederick Loewe, at the Gateway Playhouse in Bellport; Keith Andrews directs and starring David Bryant Johnson, Jennifer Hope Wills and Jaime Jackson (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: Strong voices lift “My Fair Lady,” a Lerner and Loewe masterpiece, above some awkward scenery and acting at the Gateway Playhouse in Bellport.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘My Fair Lady,’ at the Gateway Playhouse
headline.main: From Flower Girl to Loverly Lady, Accent and All
headline.print_headline: From Flower Girl To Loverly Lady, Accent and All
